intro: Lefebvrea zenkeri, commonly known as the Zenker's stromboid, is a species of sea snail endemic to the Indo-Pacific region. It belongs to the family Strombidae, commonly referred to as the "giant cowries." The shell of Lefebvrea zenkeri is typically smooth and glossy, with a deep, elongated spiral and a thick, heavy body whorl. It is characterized by its distinctive coloration, often featuring a dark base with intricate patterns of lighter markings. This species is primarily found in tropical marine environments, where it inhabits rocky substrates and shallow reef areas.
